result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ariel Krion Walker in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Ariel Krion Walker in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing with Defendant's other cases 21CF3655 and 22CF2135. Discussion placed on the record. Defense provided update regarding case 22CF2135. Defense requested date for Plea hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea hearing, Branch 40. Plea hearing scheduled December 13, 2022 at 1:30 pm. Hearing will be held IN PERSON in room 634 of the Courthouse.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Ariel Krion Walker not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing.  Defense requests an adjourned plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  This matter will be held in person in room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourend to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Ariel Krion Walker not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in Court for a Status Conference. Defense requests a plea date. Court set matter as requested. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Ariel Krion Walker not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status conference.  Parties request another status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Ariel Krion Walker not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a status conference. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Original Transcript  PRELIMINARY HEARING (14 pages) commencing 02-14-2022  by WILLIAM CARPENTER

Defendant Ariel Krion Walker in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Ariel Krion Walker in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Court took judicial notice of 21CF3655. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer C. Boyack. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Thomas E H

Defendant Ariel Krion Walker in court with attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Defendant Ariel Krion Walker in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant has lower number case pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Shelton. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
